abstract.p: Jean Rawitt letter on Apr 26 article hails two men who formed partnership over their desire to work with schoolchildren

block.p: Your article about two men of different backgrounds who formed a partnership over their desire to work with schoolchildren is truly inspiring (''2 Men's Meeting of Mind and Spirit, in the 5th Grade,'' Education page, April 26).
These two remarkable men provide firm discipline; caring and down-to-earth role models; and a belief in the intrinsic worth of these children and the value of teaching them.

Your article about two men of different backgrounds who formed a partnership over their desire to work with schoolchildren is truly inspiring (''2 Men's Meeting of Mind and Spirit, in the 5th Grade,'' Education page, April 26).
These two remarkable men provide firm discipline; caring and down-to-earth role models; and a belief in the intrinsic worth of these children and the value of teaching them.

What the children gain is a justifiable pride in accomplishment, pride in the group and pride in themselves. These are the greatest gifts with which a child can be endowed. Why is this model so rarely replicated in today's schools?
